column4: Trying to install 11.4 on a machine with a sata hd and ide cdrom.  I've messed with the bios for 3 hours and it just will not mount the cdrom when I try to boot the live environment.  Anyone have ideas?
I've also googled for help and have seen people have issues, but no useful solutions.
do you know the hotkey to bring up the boot menu during boot for your motherboard
yes, i've used it to turn off splash and queit mode.  I've tried mounting cdrom from busybox, but it gives and 'Invalid Argument' error
i'd rather not have to run home to burn the alt cd, but do you think that is my only option?
Hmm, dmesg shows 'attempt to access beyond end of device'
I mean I cant understand why I'm having so much trouble with a fairly common system from about 3 years ago, quite annoying :/
you dont need alternate cd to get it installed. you need to know what your boot key is
I think you're not understanding my problem, the cd boots fine, but it dumps into busybox when it attempts to boot the live environment.
the cdrom works, this machine had windows and it was fine and the cd boots fine
would it matter that i put the iso image on a dvd-r?
